❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️ am i the only one that is ready for halloween i have been ready since last halloween was over so i made the creepy crawly spider sock pattern they are creepy and crawling with spiders on all sides spiders are not my favorite now i am not scared of them but they are not my favorite the fact they can crawl right on up your leg or where ever and you can t feel them creeps me right out and where i will startle myself more than once if i happen to catch my little spider friend on my creepy crawly spider socks the fact that they are fun and adorable makes it all worth it especially as i begin my halloween prep pattern pack discounts use code save10 for 10% off $10 save15 for 15% off $15 save20 for 20% off $20 more cannot be combined with other offers **creepy crawly crochet spider sock supplies ** **video tutorial ** https //youtu be/ei0bjpsuuoy 1 **supplies crochet hook ** furls hook size 3 5mm & 2 5mm hooks 2 **notions ** removable stitch markers if needed 3 yarn needle to weave in ends 4 scissors 5 blocking mats and pins 6 optional **yarn ** wecrochet hawthorne speckle 7 80% fine superwash highland wool 20% nylon 357yds/100g colorways in images spark speckle wecrochet stroll 8 75% fine superwash merino wools 25% nylon **abbreviations/stitches ** blo back loop only chain chain est st pat established stitch pattern round round single_crochet single_crochet 9 ssc split single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch st s stitch es **gauge ** 20 sts x 25 row = 4×4 inches in estab- lished stitch pattern see notes **skill level ** intermediate **size ** this sock is meant to be crocheted for a custom fit to your foot this sock can be tried on and adjusted as you go instructions are for adult women s sizes the chart on the blog is for referencing sock lengths for different sizes the pattern on the blog the free version of this pattern supported by advertisements can be found on my blog at http //www brianakdesigns com/ **let
